DOC.brief_summary: The aim of this study is to compare cold snare polypectomy and conventional polypectomy for the removal and retrieval of small colorectal polyps. Cold snare polypectomy for colorectal polyps up to 8 mm is expected to be more effective than conventional polypectomy.
DOC.brief_title: Prospective Randomized Comparison of Cold Snare Polypectomy and Conventional Polypectomy
DOC.criteria: Inclusion criteria: Men or women between 20 and 100 years of age Exclusion criteria include age less than 20 years old Pregnant, American Society of Anesthesiologists class III and IV Overweight (body weight > 100 kg) Allergic to the drugs used or its components (soybeans or eggs) Poor bowel preparation or postcolorectal surgery.
